question: Which of the following negligences refers to defective hospital care and equipment, incompetent employees, and failure to maintain the standards of care?

A 20-year-old male presents to the emergency department with complaints of fever, fatigue, and headache for the past 10 days. He is now experiencing agitation and hallucination, with aggressive behavior. History suggests that he suffered a dog bite 4 weeks ago. On examination, he is found to have excessive salivation, hyperreflexia, and spasticity. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the treatment for acute typhoid fever?

All the travelers who are exposed to the risk of yellow fever or pass through the endemic zones of yellow fever should have a valid vaccination card for yellow fever before they enter a country. If any of them fails to possess the card, which of the following should be done?
What is the gold-standard investigation for typhoid?
Which of the following refers to the restriction of the movement of a sick person in order to stop the spread of certain diseases?
In the case of the transfer of malaria protozoa by the mosquito, which of the following forms is transferred?
A child presents to the clinic with fever and convulsions. The child was bitten by a dog 3 months ago. Which of the following samples must be obtained to confirm a diagnosis of rabies?
What is an unusual, more than expected occurrence of a disease or any event related to health, in a community, called?

A 25-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of a painless ulcer on the shaft of the penis. He has no symptoms otherwise. Clinical examination reveals rubbery enlargement of bilateral inguinal lymph nodes. What is the most likely causative agent?

A 5-year-old female child is brought to the clinic with loose stools for the past 4 days. On examination, the child is irritable with skin pinch going back in 3 seconds. No other signs of dehydration are observed. What is the replacement fluid and dosage to be given as per the IMNCI protocol?

answers.option: 100 ml/kg IV Ringer's lactate every 6 hours
100-200 ml ORS after every loose stool
Increasing frequency of breastfeeding with 100-200 ml ORS

question: A 20-year-old unconscious male is brought to the emergency room with profuse bleeding from the incised wound on his left wrist. Which of the following types of consent will be used to treat this patient?
The lawyer of the defendant calls in a ballistic expert as part of the proceedings of a suspected homicide. Which of the following is not true regarding this type of witness?

answers.option: A doctor may be common or expert witness

question: What is the correct legal terminology for a verbal statement made by a dying individual in front of a doctor narrating the circumstances leading to his/her death?
During a police encounter, a dacoit is shot dead. Who will carry out the investigation in this case?
A doctor receives 5 cases of cholera together at his private clinic in Lahore. He should report these cases to which of the following authorities?
What is the drug of choice in cestode infection?

A 36-year-old woman, with a known case of HIV infection, has a very low CD4 lymphocyte count and was prescribed treatment. She is non-compliant with her medications and now presents with shortness of breath on exertion and hypoxia. Her chest X-ray reveals fine bilateral infiltrates and the computed tomography (CT) scan reports a bilateral ground-glass appearance. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A young patient presents to the clinic with complaints of acute watery diarrhea without abdominal pain, along with vomiting. The stool is rice-watery in nature. What is the most likely cause?
Which of the following antimalarial drugs is effective against the exo-erythrocytic form of malarial parasite?

A 15-year-old boy comes into the emergency department. He has had a history of fever for the last 2 weeks, initially, low-grade 100 F, followed by high-grade with severe abdominal pain. His blood culture is done as an outpatient is positive for Salmonella typhi with sensitivity to azithromycin and imipenem-cilastatin. An X-ray of the abdomen, erect and supine, shows gas under the right diaphragm. What is the most common site of gut perforation in enteric fever?

A patient complains of having recurrent malarial infection after recovering from it once, caused by Plasmodium ovale and Plasmodium vivax. Which form of these Plasmodium species is responsible for the relapses?
A convict is called numerous times to attend a trial in court, but he fails to appear. Ultimately the court orders a summons to be put outside his house. Which of the following describes a summons?

answers.option: A fee tendered to cover court expenses
Letter to a person to appear in court for evidence or any other reason
A warrant to arrest the person and present them in the court
A letter that can only issued by the magistrate
A rectangular scripture to call upon an entity for assistance

question: A doctor is called in sessions court as a witness. During cross-examination, he utters an indecent remark on the defense counsel, which is brought to the knowledge of the judge who gives minimum punishment to the doctor. Which of the following would it be?

answers.option: Detaining him in the court till rising of the court for the day
Warning in writing with copy to the employer

question: A young male develops a high-grade fever intermittent in nature and occurring every 48 hours. Later on, his laboratory report reveals that he has vivax malaria. Which subtype fever does he have?
Which of the following is an appropriate drug in the treatment of acute enteric fever?

The present-day societies have high expectations from medical professionals regarding their ideal ethical practice. The broader guidelines can be learned from the subject of medical ethics. What does this subject deal with?

answers.option: Interpersonal relationships are the basic requirement
Confidentiality of patient record as an ideal ethical practice
Moral values to be observed by medical professional in their practice
Research ethics should be made mandatory

question: For which of the following disorders is chloroquine used as an anti-inflammatory drug?
Which of the following drugs acts by increasing the GABA activity?
Leaving gauze in abdominal surgery comes under which negligence?

A 6-year-old child took his father's pistol to show to his friends but the pistol accidentally went off. One of his friends got injured. Under the law, the child is considered as which of the following?

A 35-year-old diabetic patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of fever associated with rigor and chills and increased frequency of urine. There are no other significant findings. What is the most probable cause?

A patient in the hospital was on the ventilator and got treated for an illness with clindamycin, ethambutol, and some other antibiotics. He then got extubated and was started on meropenem 10 days ago. Two days ago he presented with watery diarrhea suggesting a C. difficile infection. How will this condition be managed?

answers.option: Stop all antibiotics and send stool sample for ova and parasite
Stop meropenem and give oral metronidazole

question: A 16-year-old male presents with a complaint of high-grade fever with chills and rigors for five days along with severe body aches and pains. On peripheral examination, the patient is febrile. On systemic examination, no significant finding was found except his petechial rashes all over the extremities. What would the most likely diagnosis be?
Zieman dots with basket forms and occasional band forms of plasmodium are seen in which of the following?
At what CD4+ count of a patient with human immunodeficiency virus do AIDS-defining illnesses emerge?

A 20-year-old female presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of fever on alternate days, documented to be 103-104 °F, along with sweating and chills. She also had malaise, vomiting, weakness, muscle pain, and headache. She was pale and had a palpable spleen on examination. What is the most likely cause?

A 7-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department with a complaint of fever and vesicular rashes all over the body. The vesicles appear in bunches and some are in the healing phase. There is a history of sore throat and cough too. What is the long-term complication of the condition at a later age?

A 14-year-old girl presents to the clinic with a complaint of a hypopigmented patch on her face. On examination, it is a well-demarcated area of skin that does not respond to pain stimuli. How is the condition diagnosed?

A 6-day-old neonate is brought to the pediatric emergency with a history of fits and refusal to take feed. The fits are more severe on exposure to light and excessive sound. The neonate was delivered at home. What is the causative organism?

Shigella dysenteriae causes fever, abdominal pain, and bloody diarrhea in humans. The infection is due to the release of Shiga toxin, which promotes tissue invasion in the large intestine. What is another name for Shiga toxin?

A 25-year-old fisherman presented to the outpatient department with complaints of abdominal discomfort and diarrhea. His complete blood picture showed megaloblastic anemia and his stool had numerous oval operculated brown eggs. Which parasite is the cause of his condition?
Salmonella typhi is transmitted by the orofecal route and is the causative agent of typhoid fever. What is the primary site of infection?

answers.option: Mononuclear phagocytic cells in the large intestine
Mononuclear phagocytic cells in the spleen
Mononuclear phagocytic cells in the liver
Mononuclear phagocytic cells in the liver and spleen
Mononuclear phagocytic cells in the liver and Peyer's patches

question: A 15-year-old boy presented to the outpatient department with fever, rash, and conjunctivitis. The rash appeared first on the face and then spread to the extremities including the palms and soles. Which viral infection is the boy suffering from?

A 45-year-old man presented to the outpatient department with fever, constipation, and abdominal tenderness. Blood culture showed growth of non-lactose fermenting (colorless) gram-negative bacteria on MacConkey's agar and the production of hydrogen sulfide gas on TSI agar. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presented with fever, chills, sweating, weakness, and headache, presumptively diagnosed as 'viral syndrome'. The patient's condition later deteriorated with altered level of consciousness, severe anemia, renal failure, and multisystem failure. Blood sample investigation showed malarial parasite. Crescent or sausage (banana) shaped gametocytes are a characteristic of which plasmodium species?

Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) can frequently be observed in patients with severe inflammatory response and has a poor prognosis. Coagulation pathway activation leads to small vessels occlusion leading to various organ failure symptoms. Which of the following laboratory tests is used for evidence of DIC?

Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) attacks the immune system and if untreated, can cause acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). HIV has several structural and non-structural proteins that play a role in infectivity. Which of the following is a structural gene of HIV?
Which of the following antiviral drugs inhibits the synthesis of viral DNA?
Which of the following statements is correct about the mechanism of action of mebendazole?

answers.option: Blocks acetylcholine transmission at the myoneural junction resulting in paralysis of helminths.
Inhibits oxidative phosphorylation in some species of helminths.
Increases cell membrane permeability for calcium ions, resulting in paralysis, dislodgement, and death of helminths.
Inhibits microtubule synthesis in helminths and causes irreversible impairment of glucose uptake.

question: Which drug is the most effective in treating systemic fungal infections in patients with acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS)?
Which antimalarial drug can cause blackwater fever?
Which antimalarial drug is used for causal prophylaxis?
Which of the following is/are an unwanted effect(s) of aminoglycosides?
Which antibiotic is safe to use for respiratory tract infections during the first trimester of pregnancy?
Which antibiotic can cause grey baby syndrome?
Which drug is the first line agent in the treatment of syphilis?
Which of the following is another name for visceral leishmaniasis?
Which test is helpful in the diagnosis of giardiasis?
Human cysticercosis is acquired by the ingestion of which of the following?
Ova of Schistosoma haematobium can be detected in which of the following?

A 45-year-old patient presents with right-sided focal fits. History reveals that he is an AIDS (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome) patient. Magnetic resonance imaging shows multiple ring-enhancing lesions in the cortical grey-white matter of the brain. What is the cause of fits?
A 50-year-old male HIV patient is being evaluated for AIDS-defining diseases. Which of the following is not an AIDS-defining illness?

A 50-year-old female sustained injury from rusty metal on her right finger while cleaning. She is cautious and seeks emergency treatment. You washed her wound with normal saline and dressed it. Which infection is she at risk of acquiring?

A 25-year-old male had a sexual contact with a commercial sex worker during his business trip to UAE. He developed a painless ulcer at the penile shaft after one week. What investigation will diagnose the genital ulcer?

answers.option: Tzank smear on tissue biopsy from the ulcer

question: Faisal experienced a car accident which caused him multiple injuries on the face. What are injuries on the face termed as?
During a police encounter, an armed robber shot the policeman in his abdomen. What is this penetrating injury termed as?
A 20-year-old came to you with the complaint of abdominal pain and vomiting. What type of consent will you take before starting physical examination?

An injured person presented to the emergency with a broken leg and internal fixation was done by a doctor in the operation theatre. The patient was advised to rest for two weeks but he started walking in a couple of days and developed misalignment of the fractured bone. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?

An 8-year-old child suffered from a minor injury during a picnic off from home. The teacher gave the consent for the treatment because of the absence of parents/guardians of the child. Which doctrine is applied here?
A 30-year-old married man is suffering from scabies. The doctor who treated his illness disclosed the information to his wife. What is this an example of?

A 4-year-old boy came to the outpatient department with fever for fifteen days. On examination, he was lethargic and pale, temperature was 101 °F, heart rate was 110 beats/min, and respiratory rate was 30 breaths/min. Abdominal examination showed hepatosplenomegaly. Rest of the examination was unremarkable. What is the most appropriate investigation to reach the diagnosis?

A 15-month-old girl was brought to the outpatient department with the complaint of high-grade fever and runny nose since three days. On examination, her temperature was 102 °F, heart rate was 120 beats/min, and respiratory rate was 35 breaths/min. She had a maculopapular rash all over the body, purulent discharge from the eyes, and oral thrush. Rest of the examination was unremarkable. What is the most appropriate treatment?

A 45-year-old male is suffering from high-grade fever, severe body ache, and bleeding from the nose and mouth since the last 2 days. He consulted his general physician but the prescribed medicines did not give any relief. He works as a butcher and handles alive animals. His complete blood count shows hemoglobin 14.5 g/dL, white blood cells 1200/mm³, platelet count 37000/mm³. What is the best treatment option for him?

answers.option: IV antibiotics to prevent bacterial infection
IV domperidone or any other prokinetic agent

question: A 45-year-old female had fever and chills. Malarial parasite was positive on MP-ICT. She was treated with artemisinin based combination therapy. She went to donate blood after one session. The blood bank refused donation because she had gametocytes on peripheral smear. She is worried and wants a retreatment. What should be the next step of management?

answers.option: Repeat peripheral smear from well reputed laboratory
Needs long term prophylaxis to clear the gametocytes
A different antimalarial drug should be used
Repeat course of artemisinin based combination therapy (ACT)

question: A 23-year-old medical student develops nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and diarrhea after eating street food. Her complete blood count shows hemoglobin 12.8 g/dL, white blood cells 4200/mm³, erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) 35 mm/h, and low platelet count (98000/μL). What is the most predominant feature of this condition?

answers.option: Can result in a chronic carrier state
Patient can present with rose red spots
Patient has petechia on the arms and legs
Disease can be transmitted by contact
Patient can present with bloody diarrhea

question: Which of the following is a complication of Entamoeba histolytica?
A medical worker accidentally gets pricked by a needle used on an HIV-positive patient. What is the risk percentage of him getting an HIV infection?
A man falls in the washroom and later presents with a high-grade fever. The doctor suspects that he has chronic inflammation. Which of the following are the dominant cells of chronic inflammation?
Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) has structural genes and functional genes. Which of the following is a structural gene in HIV?
Penicillin should not be administered via which of the following routes?
Which of the following is a non-infectious cause of vaginal discharge?
Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole is used to treat which of the following infections in HIV-positive patients?

A medical officer detects an HIV (human immunodeficiency virus) positive case in the blood bank and searches for the sexual partner of the donor to prevent and treat the disease in the partner. Which process is described here?
A person, while traveling, carries a disease with him from an area where it is highly prevalent, to a place in which it does not normally occur. Which of the following terms is used for it?

A young female presents to the outpatient department with greenish, foul-smelling vaginal discharge. A wet mount shows pear-shaped trophozoites with a jerky motion. Which of the following is the most likely organism involved?
In an AIDS (acquired immune deficiency syndrome) patient, purplish, non-blanching nodules appear in the lower extremities. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient starts having diarrhea after taking antibiotics during his hospital stay. Which organism is most likely involved?
Which of the following organisms can cause cervical cancer and anogenital warts known as condylomata acuminata?
Which of the following infections in sexually active women does not cause vaginal discharge?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with abdominal pain, relative bradycardia, and a fever that started as low-grade but has been persistently increasing for days. He also has salmon-colored spots on his trunk. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents to the clinic with a high-grade fever, productive cough, and a runny nose with red eyes. He, later on, notices a maculopapular rash beginning to appear on his forehead. What is the patient most likely suffering from?

A child is brought to the clinic for having loose stools with a frequency of 20 per day. On examination, normal skin turgor and no sunken eyes are found. When water is offered, he drinks it eagerly. What is the classification according to IMNCI?
What is the term used for diarrhea (with or without blood in stool) that starts acutely and occurs for at least 14 days?
Which of the following stages of the malarial parasite is liberated after the rupture of erythrocytes?
A person having mucopurulent urethral discharge is diagnosed with gonorrhea. Which of the following will be shown on culture?

answers.option: Gram positive cocci in grape like cluster
Gram negative cocci in grape like cluster

question: A child is brought to the pediatrics clinic for evaluation of diarrhea. His systemic findings are unremarkable except that he has less weight and height for his age. It is found that he has malabsorption syndrome. What is the causative agent in this case?

A patient presents to the clinic with a complaint of bloody diarrhea. A sorbitol-negative strain of Escherichia coli is found to be the causative agent. Which of the following has caused this condition?
A person presents to the clinic with bloody diarrhea and is diagnosed with intestinal amebiasis caused by Entamoeba histolytica. Which of the following is true for this organism?

An 18-year-old man is having conjunctival erythema with lacrimation and purulent discharge more prominent in the left eye. He consults his ophthalmologist who tells him that he is having follicular conjunctivitis and punctate keratitis. Giemsa stain shows cytoplasmic inclusions with no growth on culture with Gram stain. What is the most likely cause?
Which of the following is used for the treatment of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus?
Which of the following drugs is a protease inhibitor?
A child presents with high-grade fever, runny nose, and cough. White lesions are found on the oral mucosa. What is the pathognomonic sign for measles?

A 28-year-old man has a fever, headache, and a rash present on his trunk and extremities with itching. On examinations, vesicles and papules of varying sizes are seen on his trunk and extremities and some are in the healing stage. What is the likely diagnosis?
A woman is admitted for an elective/non-emergency procedure. Which type of consent should be taken before the operation?
Which of the following statements is true about chloramphenicol?

answers.option: It inhibits the 50S subunit of ribosomes

question: An old man came with slowly progressive hypopigmented skin lesions on the chest and abdomen. He had a previous history of skin lesions that healed spontaneously. He also reported loss of sensation in some regions of his skin and thickened nerves. What stain will be used to visualize the causative organism?

A patient comes to the emergency department with a history of prolonged cough, fever, and chest infection. He is diagnosed with a case of tuberculosis after getting confirmation from the report of the biopsy. What is tuberculosis characterized by?

A blood culture shows the growth of non-lactose fermenting (colorless), gram-negative bacteria on MacConkey's agar and the production of hydrogen sulfide gas on TSI agar. Which of the following is the most likely organism?

A 35-year-old male presents to the clinic with hypopigmented lesions on his limbs and back. He has been treated with antifungals but did not heal. He has also developed polyarthritis with edema. He has thick cutaneous nerves, radial, ulnar, and tibial nerves. The nerves are painful and tender. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient had a hypopigmented skin lesion on one side, which progressed to multiple sites. Some of these lesions resolved on their own and then new lesions appeared. He also has anorexia, fever, and weight loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A female patient presents to the clinic with a complaint of purulent vaginal discharge. Gram staining of the discharge reveals gram-negative diplococci. What is the best treatment?

A 35-year-old diabetic patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of fever associated with rigors and chills, and increased frequency of urine. She also complains of pain during micturition. Other systemic findings are unremarkable. What is the most accurate test for diagnosis?
A patient presents to the clinic with complaints of cough and chest pain suggestive of pneumonia. He has had a splenectomy. Which of the following gram-positive organisms can be the causative agent?
Which of the following organisms is commonly responsible for causing watery diarrhea in less than 5-year-olds and results in more than 2 million hospital admissions annually?

A man presents to the clinic with the complaint of a thick, yellow, mucoid, and purulent urethral discharge. He has had a new sexual partner for two weeks. Which infections would you consider in this patient?

A patient is brought to the clinic with the complaint of fever, cough, dyspnea, and cyanosis. He also has tachycardia and his blood pressure is 80/60 mmHg. On auscultation, crackles and decreased breath sounds can be heard in the right lower lobe. What is the diagnosis?
The coagulation cascade in systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS) is mediated by which of the following?
Which of the following cells are found in the synovium of the joint in case of acute arthritis?
Which of the following leads to the dilation of the arterioles and increased venous permeability?

A 40-year-old male presents with dyspnea, cyanosis, and tachycardia. He is a chain smoker and there is a ventilation-perfusion mismatch on the V/Q scan. Which of the following lung complications can result as a result of systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS)?
Which of the following statements about interferon-α is incorrect?

answers.option: Lamivudine interferes with its activity against hepatitis B
At the start of treatment, most patients experience flu like symptoms
Indications include treatment of genital warts
It is used in the management of hepatitis C

question: Which of the following is an important dose-dependent adverse effect of dapsone?
Which of the following is a late complication of measles?

A person, before going on a trip to a malaria-endemic area, takes prophylaxis for chloroquine-resistant falciparum malaria but nonetheless develops Plasmodium vivax malaria. Which of the following drugs did he most likely take?
Which of the following antimalarial drugs acts as a blood schizonticide and a sporontocide?

A housewife presents to the clinic with severe abdominal pain and diarrhea which started off as watery but now contains blood in it. Laboratory findings show leukocytes and red blood cells in the stool. She denies having eaten any undercooked food in the past week. Which of the following organisms is most likely involved?
There is a patient with a clear indication of sepsis. He also has marked hypotension. What is the most appropriate management at this point?

answers.option: Give him a heavy dose of corticosteroids as soon as possible
Treat the patient with empirical antibiotics after culture and sensitivity
Aggressive fluid resuscitation to keep central venous pressure 8-12 mm Hg
Persistent blood transfusions to keep his Hb at >10 g/dl

question: A patient who was diagnosed with AIDS (acquired immune deficiency syndrome) and tuberculosis (TB) 2 years back is admitted for surgery for appendicitis. He is compliant with HIV medications. He completed anti-TB therapy and now his chest x-ray is clear with no pulmonary infiltrates and no bacteria in his sputum. What precautions should be taken?

answers.option: Single room with contact and airborne precautions

question: A health officer has taken up the challenge to eradicate HIV (human immunodeficiency virus). His team identified groups of high-risk individuals. Which of the following high-risk groups should be intervened first?

A man presents to the hospital with an altered level of consciousness two hours after falling in the washroom. He has pinpoint pupils with a pulse of 78 beats per minute, a blood pressure of 180/120 mmHg, and a fever of 107°F despite antipyretics. Sponging is also of no use. What is the most likely cause of fever?

A 25-year-old male presented with fever and abdominal pain. His illness started with low-grade fever and decreased appetite. He has been unwell for the past 7 days and has per rectal bleeding for the last 2 days. Initially, he took per ciprofloxacin for 3 days followed by oral cefixime and azithromycin for 4 days. He was started on intravenous (IV) ceftriaxone. What is the most appropriate diagnostic test?

answers.option: Complete blood picture with peripheral film
